meanings.sent1: The rugate fabric felt rough against her skin.
meanings.sent2: The old tree had a rugate bark that provided a good grip for climbing.
meanings.sent3: The rugate road looked like a bumpy rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent4: The rugate mountain range resembled a crumpled paper map.
meanings.sent5: The rugate texture of the wall made it difficult to paint smoothly.

meanings.sent1: She carefully rugated the paper to give it a textured look.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the constant movement of the waves rugates the sand on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to rugate the edges of the pie crust for a decorative touch.
meanings.sent4: The wind can rugate the surface of the water, creating small ripples.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor used a tool to rugate the clay, adding depth to the sculpture.
